reviews.review_msg: The course would have been good if the TA Ashley wasn't so strict when marking. There were some extremely time consuming assignments for a first year class. Some of the homework instructions were unclear especially the ones that required Google Earth.

Probably my favourite professor. GEOG 100 was sometimes a little boring with content but it was designed in a way to make you relate to your place in the world and you could choose a topic you wanted to research which made the assignments interesting. She really cares about student's learning and you can see that in the way she teaches.

Honestly? Loved this course way more than I expected. Dr. Roderick is super chill but really knows her stuff. Assignments were clear, instructions were posted early, and if anything was confusing, she explained it fast.  Would totally take another class with her!

Absolutely loved this class. Yes, the assignments push you, but Dr. Roderick explains everything super clearly. The TA I had was fair and really helpful — definitely felt like the course was designed for students to succeed if they made an honest effort. Plus, the course materials were interesting and super relevant to real-world issues.

Incredible communication and support.
Some people complained about response times, but every time I emailed Professor Roderick, she got back to me quickly and thoroughly.  She really cares about her students succeeding — I felt like she was rooting for us the entire semester. I'd take her again!

If you want to use ChatGPT, run.  If you want to become the weaponized version of yourself, take her class.  The second you submit work that's half-baked, she politely hands you your own brain on a silver platter and asks if you'd like to try again.

Respect the craft, and for the love of academia, proofread your thesis statements.

The professor was good, but the homework criteria are very vague and I had trouble understanding it every time and had to ask and get answers very late. Ashley, the teaching assistant, was so rude, crazy and unfair that you have no idea. This course is not for improving your GPA at all and is as heavy as a level 4 course. Skip it if you can.

Had this prof for GEOG104 and it was great. But wow, a complete 180 for GEOG100. Like everyone else has said, assignment criteria/instructions were all over the place and really harsh/unfair grading and the TAs were abysmal.

Boring recorded lectures. Vague details and instructions for assignments. Emailed the teacher for help multiple times, and her only response was "refer to the discussions" which helped somewhat, but if you're going to respond to me, you might as well answer my questions. Ashley Tegart, the TA, was such a hard marker. She is (NOT) paycheck stealing.

Lackluster lecture videos. Assignment instructions were always confusing, vague, and filled with errors. To make matters worse, the TAs (specifically Ashley) were extremely unfair, harsh, and inaccurate with marking. Genuinely have never seen such strict and unfair marking policies.

Easy weekly activities worth 5 percent,  but the assignment grading seemed erratic and unclear. The projects were also very time consuming and the prof was not reachable at all outside class discussions form. You need to book office hours weeks in advance and prof would often just not show up.

Does not seem like Prof cared about this course. She uses 10 min pre recorded vids per week. All the learning is self directed from the textbook, prof offer no explanation or direction. The assignment instructions are vague, TA's use arbitrary and biased marking schemes, overall lack of effort from the teaching team.
easy courses with weekly quizzes and assignments, but it takes 48hrs for the prof to reply to my email about the final project, cuz the instructions are bit confused and unclear.
Weekly lecture videos and discussion/activities that take around an hour to do. The projects and exams were very straightforward. Lecture videos are also nice and short.

She's a very nice and flexible prof. I think the people who gave her a low score expected the class to be a super easy gpa booster without putting much work in. That being said, it's almost impossible to get an A+ because the TA are very particular and hash, but an A or A- is very achievable if you do all the work and put in some effort.

Leanne is a very flexible prof with a 3 day extension on every other assignment. Each week there was one very short lecture and a simple quiz after. One thing that sucked was the marking. The TA's were sometimes very picky and for the poster project your group members decided your mark and you can't do anything about it.
The proff is good however, the T.A's in this course are awful. They are nit picky and mark you very heavily on assignments. Warning: Only take this course if you're ready to impress the TAs.

Assignments with 3 day grace period. Only Drawback is that she does not reply to your email and even in discussion forum quicky, even though she says she checks it all the time. Many students have complained regarding the Google Earth not working properly but she does not help in fixing the issue and we as students are missing marks on it.

I've taken 2 online GEOG classes with Leanne and she's great! She is flexible with deadlines and has detailed assignment instructions. Her content usually includes a lot of material but there were no exams. She allows you to skip a couple of quizzes and discussion posts with no deductions.
snooze fest + D tier TA's

great prof, super caring and was super flexible for almost all deadlines. The class material is boring and easy to the point where the quizzes are straight logic. TAs are awful tho especially jade, they mark extremely hard despite the lack of instructions on the rubric and are extremely condescending when giving feedback. Kaku was the only good TA

Dr. Roderick is a great prof - most if not all of the TAs were awful. Each CEA was graded so harshly, don't even know how anyone can get more than 4-4.5 / 5 on those. Lots of due dates each week. Overall, Dr. Roderick tried teaching as best as possible, but the TAs made the course a really bad experience. If your grade drops early on, good luck..

There is nothing to say about the professor, she is genuinely caring about the students. However, the TAs are the absolute disaster. No explanation on the rubrics, no guidance, feels like the purposefully try to grade you average. Seemed like the expectations from the professors and marking team differ. Unprofessional attitude of TA was horrible

Dr. Roderick was super approachable in the discussion forums. Intersession is very intense but I feel she paced the course in the best way possible given the time crunch. EXTREMELY forgiving late policy as well! Only complaint is each TA had a wildly different harshness for marking. She genuinely wants you to enjoy geography, overall great prof!

This class isn't hard like the others are saying, but it's extremely boring and there's a lot of busy work. The content is uninteresting and the rubric is really vague. The TAs pretty much slap a Meets Expectation on everything and call it a day to meet a certain average. Overall I would not take this class again, absolute snooze fest.

idk why people are saying "there's so many assignments" as if this course is not condensed into a half semester course... Shes a good and nice prof overall and she gives a three day grace period so you can hand in your stuff later. Im balancing a part time job, social life and school and its manageable. Take her in the fall if you struggle

The prof herself is OK but the course is  intense. If you take it intersession, there's a heavy amount of work you have to do every week. If you're keeping up with the course, there's always something almost due every single day. Moreover, the TAs mark hard, where this course is not even being a GPA booster. Only take this course if you love geog

I am so upset over the overwhelming amount of assignment this professor is giving us. There is no break, doing assigments even on weekends! If you are looking for something easy for summer this is NOT THE COURSE. I am so overwhelmed. I will never take this professor again!!!!

Way too many pointless tasks and assignments that take too long. I'm paying too much money for this course to reflect on my time in nature and to write a letter to my future self Lol. This is stuff I did in grade 4.

If you are looking for something light, do not take this class. It's a 100 level course, yet it feels like a 300 level course with the amount of work you have to put in. I don't know what's wrong with that professor.

Her online class was very well-structured and clearly laid out. She marked fairly and the assignments were straight-forward. Only thing I didn't really like was the novel study, but she gave ample time between check-ins so it wasn't too bad. Overall would recommend this course!

Course was pretty easy and straightforward, especially with no final, however, don't expect an A+ or anything because that is virtually impossible due to the small rooms for error you can have on some of the heavily weighted assesments
P.S the textbook readings are useless i didn't open it once
Leanne was a good prof and the course was not overly difficult. She was also very accommodating.

Honestly surprised at how low her rating is !! You have to read the course material and watch the lectures to do well in this class, but all the material is interesting so it's not too difficult. Dr. Roderick also goes out of her way to make the course better for students (ex. changing things about the tests after student feedback).

It's a good course to take. I took the readings instead of the lecture, as it helped much more. She uses a completed/uncompleted grading system, so it's almost a guaranteed B or B+. However, if you wanted an A or higher you would have to do extra projects, which I did, but I didn't meet the criteria on one thing which messed me up.
Easy and light class with 2 major assignments, just watch lectures and memorize the concept and you're good to go

It was an easy class overall, with only a couple big assignments. I DID NOT read a textbook at all and did not go to optional zoom meetings. Just watched her slides, it was enough.

A few assignments took a while to write so make sure to start early. She gave us enough time (even too much) to do them. The easiest class I have even taken.

Had to take this class to fulfill my degree-related social science/science breadth requirements as part of graduation. By far, my worst class grade-wise this term given how awful this prof was since she expected the students to come in with 300-400 level stuff knowledge.

Pretty straightforward course, as long as you review lecture slides and study the learning goals you will do fine. Dr. Roderick was an amazing professor, she was caring and even gave us a 1% bonus for completing the course review survey. Assignments weren't too difficult and I learned a lot about our climate in this course. Highly Recommend!

Content is straightforward/prof is passionate and caring. TAs grade harshly sometimes, just focus on meeting criteria in rubrics and ur good. I got the textbook but didn't do any readings b/c lecture content overlapped with them. Do the other readings/short vids tho! Study for quizzes/final using weekly learning goals and you'll get an easy A.

Perhaps GEOG162 is Prof Roderick's better course because this online class was engaging, and the activities were fun if you are willing to make it fun. Other than that, I took this as a requirement, and I recommend it to anyone considering this course as her being the prof for it.

Lots of smaller assignments that are effort-based to help ensure you understand the big concepts. The prof was understanding whenI found myself in a tight spot with meeting deadlines.  A lot of what people are complaining about are beyond the prof's control - e.g. an online exam for 400 students would crash the Canvas server.

Took this course as an elective thinking it'd be easy for a 100 level but it's my worst class this sem because I couldn't understand anything. Leanne reads off the slides, not explaining concepts in depth. Worked hard on my poster project and got 50% on it without proper feedback. Also an in person final for an online class at 7-10pm is insane !!

I loved taking this course with Dr, Roderick. She struggled a bit technology wise, but was super caring and engaging. You can tell she wants her students to succeed! I will definitely be taking more courses from her.

Dr. Roderick is super nice and seems to genuinely care about her students. However, the lectures were uninformative and she just read off slides. Most issues (large class size of 400, and inconsistent marking by TAs) are genuinely out of her control for the most part. She's a great person but it's unfortunate that the course was not.

This course is meant to be easy as 100 level, but I will add on to other people, she along with her TAs confused us so much. To this day, I do not know what she or TAs expect from us, so lost studying for the exam. The readings and videos all seem to cover the same idea but are phrased differently, don't know how much detail I have to memorize.

They expect us to know 400 level stuff and marked my assignments acc to that, I do not know who gave her TEACHING EXCELLENCE AWARD, I mean, she reads off Tara Holland's slides. Is that reasonable? This GPA booster took more of my time as compared to my 400 level business courses, PLEASE DO NOT TAKE THIS PROF OR THE COURSE, TAKE OTHER COURSES!!!

WORST PROFESSOR EVER! If you think this will be a GPA booster, please rethink. Worst prof, worst course, hell TAs. Do not take this course ever! 3 major assignments and the grading was unclear, TAs expect us to know 300-400 level stuff that we are supposed to know for a 100 level course, I mean, al least be reasonable!!!!

I'm not sure why Leanne has so many positive reviews on here, as I've taken two classes with her and haven't been impressed for either one. Her lectures have little to no content in them, the tutorials are completely disconnected from the lecture content, and the readings are useless. Grading is all over the place. Do not recommend for 324 or 363

DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS AS A GPA BOOSTER. You will not get above 80%. So many articles and textbook pages to read WEEKLY. Absolutely atrocious. An online class with an in-person exam that is cumulative. Terrible terrible TERRIBLE. STAY AWAYYYYYYYYY

Tedious class with so many little things due every week on top of lectures, alongside unclear grading criteria. It's my last semester, and this is one of the most tedious workloads I have ever had for a class. Prof introduces assignments in the week it's due, which is not helpful at all when you are balancing other courses. Would not recommend!

Weekly class engagement act. were for 1% but considering how tedious they were, should have been like 30%. Quizzes were so hard, I studied for the whole week and still got 8/11. Unclear questions and 'choose all that apply' made it worse. Never recommend class with this professor, please don't think its a gpa booster because it is not!!

This "GPA-boosting" elective has consumed so much of my time from the weekly participation, quizzes and assignments, more than my upper-level classes. The lecture is useless. Quizzes feel tedious. The canvas page is so painful to go through. TAs are hard markers. Textbook readings + many mini articles + engagements are assigned every. week.

Worst class I've ever taken at SFU (I'm in 3rd year). Everything was graded super unfairly, the class has so many people that the TAs don't wanna deal with people complaining about marks. I don't know why people say this is an easy A! Such ridiculous assignments (and a lot of them)! Unorganized class, wrong dates on canvas, I could go on...

The professor for this class directly reads off the slides and uses all the course material by Dr. Tara Holland. I understand running a course can be difficult but atleast not read directly off the slides or have so many things due each week. Since this class is online yet we have an in-person final exam covering the whole course.

Enthusiastic and engaging professor. However, the course has too many little things due every week on top of lectures to watch and readings which makes the class take more time and work and the final is in-person for an online class.

Dr. Roderick was really kind & clearly very smart, which came across in her lecture material. Assignments could get pretty lengthy, but were not difficult content-wise. Very lenient marker! I have recommended many people to take a course with her if possible.

Dr. Roderick is a solid professor, but this course is way too much work. For a three-credit course, the workload is too heavy. Some weeks you submit over 3000 words in assignments. If you do the work, you can get a guaranteed "A," but you must invest a lot of time in the course, which can be difficult if you are balancing a full course load.

Super supportive no matter the situation. My biggest advice is just get the work done like no matter how tedious it seems. It's very work-heavy, lot's of assignments and projects that take a while to complete, but none of it is hard at all. She also let's you make changes to literally every assignment, so if u keep up it's a guaranteed A.
Very simple class. Though pay close attention to the extra assignments to increase your mark as 1 assignment could prevent you from reaching anything higher than a B+

Dr. Roderick is caring, kind, and very responsive in emails/office hours. Although it isn't really in her control, this course requires a lot of effort as it is mostly labour-based grading. I was caught off guard at the amount of work required to do well in the course seeing as it is a first year course, but if you work hard, it is feasible.

This is my second geog class with Dr. Roderick. She is a fantastic lecturer and makes the course content easy to absorb and the assignments fun to do. She brings many perspectives and really emphasizes critical thinking and open mindedness. I would highly recommend her as a prof.
The course was amazing with field trips and group assignments. She makes the class exciting and fun through the in-class activities. Overall pretty easy and entertaining course experience.

Dr. Roderick is very nice, makes lectures straightforward and the assignments were fun and interactive. Took this class for WQB credit and really enjoyed it. Definitely recommend Dr. Roderick and the course :)

The course is fairly easy for ppl who don't have science background (like me) as long as you complete all the work. Workload is not that heavy, but is broken down in many little things sometimes.
The prof is accessible through canvas discussion, and she replied in a decent amount of time (sometimes it took her longer).

The course was pretty fun; in-class activities, a field trip, and encouraged participation. Dr. Roderick is a very caring professor who structures her class to provide students with as much time and as many resources as possible. Overall pretty easy and entertaining course experience.
